name: US State Neighbors Quiz | Geography | 15 Questions

questions.text: Which state borders only one other state?
questions.explanation:
Maine.

	It only borders New Hampshire.

questions.text: Which of these bordering states pairs were *NOT* the home states of a US President and his VP?
questions.explanation:
New York and Pennsylvania.

	Clinton and Gore were from Arkansas and Tennessee, Truman and Barkley were from Missouri and Kentucky, and Grant and Colfax were from Ohio and Indiana.

questions.text: Which of these states is *NOT* one of those that meet at Four Corners?
questions.explanation:
Oklahoma.

	The other one that does is Arizona.

questions.text: There are three different points on the map where the the states of Missouri, Kentucky, and Tennessee meet.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Strange but true! A tiny bit of western Kentucky is separated from the rest of the state by the Mississippi River and Tennessee. By border definition, this bit of land which is attached to Tennessee but north of the rest of the KY-TN border is Kentucky. All other sets of 3 states that share borders only meet at one point.

questions.text: Name one of two Southern states to only have two neighbors.
questions.correct: south carolina & florida & SC & FL & Florida South Carolina & south carolina florida
questions.explanation: south carolina & florida & SC & FL & Florida South Carolina & south carolina florida.

questions.text: Name one of three states that border a Canada-bordering state and a Mexico-bordering state.
questions.explanation:
oregon & nevada & utah.

	Oregon borders Washington (Can) and California (Mex), Nevada borders Idaho (Can) and California (Mex), Utah borders Idaho (Can) and Arizona (Mex).

questions.text: A border between two states is formed in part by the Continental Divide. One of the states is Montana. What is the other one?
questions.explanation:
Idaho.

	Precipitation that falls on one side of the Continental Divide will eventually drain into the Atlantic Ocean; to the Pacific on the other side. There is also a divide line segregating Arctic Ocean drainage that runs through Alaska and Canada.

questions.text: What state that used to border Pennsylvania no longer does?
questions.explanation:
Virginia.

	Virginia once included the area that is now West Virginia, which borders Pennsylvania along its southwest corner. Virginia now comes only within 10 miles of Pennsylvania.

questions.text: Name either one of two states that border eight others, the most in the US.
Name one of three states that border Colorado and Missouri.
Which of these states does *NOT* border any of the other three?
Name one of the two states that border Wyoming and Iowa.
Name one of two states to border both Wyoming and Nevada.
Name one of three states whose border is partly formed by the Colorado River.
Name one of three states that do not have a 'triple point' (a point where three states meet) along their border.
questions.explanation:
maine & alaska & hawaii.

	Maine only border one other state (NH), so it can't have one. And both Alaska and Hawaii are not contiguous with the rest of the US states, so they have NO states as neighbors.
